Job Posting: 176690 - Position: S26 Solutions Engineering GIS Specialist Intern (Summer/May 2026, 4 Months) 176690 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Summer App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 01/14/2026 09:00 AM Through Employer Website 01/07/2026 02:53 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 City Postal Code / Zip Code Province / State Country Geotab 2440 Winston Park Dr Oakville L6H 7V2 ON Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Salary Range $ Job Description 2026 - Summer S26 Solutions Engineering GIS Specialist Intern (Summer/May 2026, 4 Months) 176690 Co-op Position Waterloo, ON Canada 4 months Hybrid CAD 0.0 per hour for 0 Major List $24 - $36 CAD Who we are: Geotab ® is a global leader in IoT and connected transportation and certified "Great Place to Work™." We are a company of diverse and talented individuals who work together to help businesses grow and succeed, and increase the safety and sustainability of our communities. Geotab is advancing security, connecting commercial vehicles to the internet and providing web-based analytics to help customers better manage their fleets. Geotab's open platform and Geotab Marketplace ®, offering hundreds of third-party solution options, allows both small and large businesses to automate operations by integrating vehicle data with their other data assets. Processing billions of data points a day, Geotab leverages data analytics and machine learning to improve productivity, optimize fleets through the reduction of fuel consumption, enhance driver safety and achieve strong compliance to regulatory changes. Our team is growing and we're looking for people who follow their passion, think differently and want to make an impact. Ours is a fast paced, ever changing environment. Geotabbers accept that challenge and are willing to take on new tasks and activities - ones that may not always be described in the initial job description. Join us for a fulfilling career with opportunities to innovate, great benefits, and our fun and inclusive work culture. Reach your full potential with Geotab. To see what it's like to be a Geotabber, check out our blog and follow us @InsideGeotab on Instagram. Join our talent network to learn more about job opportunities and company news. Who you are: As a Solutions Engineering GIS Specialist Intern, you will become familiar with all areas of the Geotab product suite, and contribute to pre-sales opportunities at all technical levels. You will be engaged from the start on exciting new opportunities and challenges to expand Geotab's footprint in the telematics industry. Day-to-day, you will be responsible for assisting the Geotab Sales team in pre- sales opportunities, running product pilots, and managing special strategic projects as required. What you'll do: You will leverage your knowledge in all aspects of the Geotab product suite to devise and build solutions to exceed end user expectations. This role will also support requests for both software and hardware product integrations. To be successful in this position, you will be a strong multi-tasker with excellent time management skills to properly monitor and prioritize various projects. You will work alongside the Sales, Software Development, Embedded Systems, Engineering Support, and Partner Account Management teams. The opportunity: • 4 month work-term beginning May 2026. • Full-time, paid internship: Monday - Friday, 37.5hrs/week. • Your first week at Geotab begins with 'GEO Launch' - a one-week Employee Orientation. Click here to learn more! • Learn more about the Geotab Campus Program here. • This posting is for an existing vacancy. How you'll make an impact: • Assist the team in identifying methods to expand our use of geospatial data within the system. • Develop proof of concepts to analyze and address client environmental impacts related to Winter Maintenance activities. • Assist the team in pilot programs for new potential customers. • Participate in engineering product and integration projects. • Learn and maintain technical knowledge of the Geotab ecosystem. • Support end-user requirements in special projects. Assist in developing, implementing, and maintaining new Geotab products. • Job Requirements What you'll bring to the role: • Completing a University degree in Geography, Environmental Studies, Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field preferred. • Strong communication, organization, and time management skills, as well as a willingness to learn and strong work ethic. • Experience with Esri ArcGIS, QGIS and/or other GIS Applications is required. • Knowledge of various map publishing and hosting methods is an asset. • Technical experience using SQL, C#, JavaScript or Google BigQuery is an asset. • Passion for technology and innovation. Ability to work well under pressure to meet deadlines in a team environment. • If you got this far, we hope you're feeling excited about this role! Even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement, we still encourage you to apply. Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Special Application Instructions Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Application Link: https://job-boards.greenhouse.io/internshiplist2000/jobs/5011566008 Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
